sentence.text: Because you have this basic insecurity , you need other people to applaud what you are doing , and admire you for it .
The English-speaking media applauded Daniel Dubroca as a player and captain on countless occasions , but still felt duty-bound to criticise him for his arbitration .
His admirers applaud him as the ` people 's lawyer " , the first solicitor in Britain to realize that victims of disasters have more chance of success if they stand and fight collectively .
If that were all , I 'd applaud it as a wise and public-spirited action and I hope it starts a trend .
Some politicians even applauded this development as the most desirable counterbalance to French pretension .
Others applauded him for standing up to America .
I think that we can all applaud my right hon. Friend for the other improvements in prison security about which he has told us .
Some even applauded the players at the end .
It seemed an altogether fitting happening , considering the same day George Bush and Boris Yeltsin were applauding each other in the White House rose garden .

` It is appropriate for spectators to applaud successful strokes in proportion to difficulty but excessive demonstrations by a player or his partisans are not proper because of the possible effect upon other competitors .
When I first came across it , I applauded the honest rigour with which Auden the critic revised Auden the poet .
I applaud him for being able to marry self-interest with the needs of others .
Even his enemies would have to applaud his courage in facing the music after one of the greatest embarrassments in England 's history .
The Palestinians , after applauding the actions of the Lebanese troops , set up shelters using tents provided by the International Committee of the Red Cross .
The crowds in the church , where protest meetings began to gain momentum last month , applauded the bishop .
` Secretly I applauded your decision . "
We applaud her stance .
This gesture is applauded by John Whitcombe , associate manager of the Overseas Development Administration 's plant sciences programme .
Not all executions were applauded by the crowd , of course .
Ken 's undying devotion to this club should be applauded by players , directors and supporters alike .
The princess was warmly applauded by the scientists for her speech .
The ban was applauded by both the SMTA and the Royal Automobile Club in Scotland .
The appointment of the mufti was applauded as a bold gesture of reconciliation to the Muslim community .
Organised by Sue Barratt , who compred the show , the models wore clothes donated to the shop and were warmly applauded .
` The world might applaud your achievement but I doubt if it will condone your methods , " Nicholson said , taking his eyes from the bandaged man to look momentarily at Dexter .
I applaud your decision to employ them , and shall leave your catalogue in the staffroom tomorrow .
We applaud the initiative of the East German citizens in liberating their secret police headquarters and share their regret that vital papers were destroyed in the shredder .
The magazine applauded the theory and looked forward to seeing the new machine in action .
He applauded the UN observer team for contributing to the peacefulness of the campaign and congratulated employers for their response to the action .
The audience had applauded loudly at the end and someone in the stalls shouted : ` Well done ! "
Melanie and Aunt Margaret applauded until their hands hurt .
Lucille , politely applauding with the rest of the room , wondered whether this man truly was the greatest soldier of his time .
When I finished , Shadwell started to applaud with the tips of his fingers , as if scared his hands would give each other a disease .
Joshua rose to his feet and applauded noisily .
Finally she began to applaud quite spontaneously , her clapping sharp and enthusiastic in the silent barn where the dust rose in the shafts of sunlight .
